alert.note: Alert for Bailey; Cochran; Parmer (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 02 at 12:10PM CDT until June 02 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock Texas has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Bailey County in northwestern Texas... Northwestern Cochran County in northwestern Texas... Southwestern Parmer County in the Panhandle of Texas... * Until 1245 PM CDT. * At 1209 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles east of Lingo, or 14 miles west of Morton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Muleshoe, Farwell, Needmore, Progress, Oklahoma Lane, Lariat, West Camp and Maple. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for the Panhandle of and northwestern Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Very heavy rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for the Panhandle of and northwestern Texas.
